articles.title: How to diffuse tension at the Thanksgiving table
articles.description: A CBS News poll finds 40 percent of people try to avoid politics on Thanksgiving. John Tierney, science columnist from The New York Times, joins "CBS This Morning" to discuss why you can't win political arguments based on fact and logic.

articles.description: Financial markets bounce back, but concerns persist over a slowdown in tech and trade tensions
articles.content: Stocks rose on Wednesday after two days of broad losses by big technology companies, which dragged U.S. indexes into the red for the year. The Dow climbed 122 points, or 0.5 percent, to 24,587 in early trade. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq also gained. A sharp dr… [+2254 chars]

articles.author: CBS Radio News
articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 11/21
articles.description: Americans hit the roads and airports for Thanksgiving. The CDC warns Americans to throw out romaine lettuce. President Trump reportedly looked into prosecuting Hillary Clinton and James Comey. CBS News Correspondent Jim Taylor has today's World News Roundup.

articles.title: Trump prioritizes economic ties to Saudi Arabia amid increasing pressure
articles.description: President Trump is declaring his support for Saudi Arabia despite evidence from his own intelligence community that Saudi leaders authorized the killing of Washington Post columnist Jamal Khashoggi. Weijia Jiang reports.

articles.title: Woman searches for family friend missing in California fires
articles.description: The first heavy rain in months is moving toward Northern California, and it's expected to complicate the search for victims in the state's worst-ever wildfire. The Camp Fire is blamed for at least 81 deaths, and 870 people are still considered missing. Meg Ol…

articles.description: Police are investigating the mysterious circumstances surrounding a possible quadruple homicide of a family at a New Jersey mansion. A massive fire broke out Tuesday at a property in the wealthy suburb of Colts Neck where authorities found four bodies. Author…

articles.title: Romaine lettuce pulled from shelves amid another E. coli outbreak
articles.description: Ahead of Thanksgiving, Americans are being warned to stay away from all romaine lettuce. The CDC says the vegetable is connected to an E. coli outbreak that's made at least 32 people sick in 11 states. Thirteen have been hospitalized. Anna Werner reports.

articles.description: Mark Zuckerberg, in an interview Tuesday night on CNN, defended his company amid allegations it concealed Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election. He also said it's "not the plan" the step down as CEO.

articles.description: A federal judge in Detroit ruled Tuesday a federal law banning female genital mutilation is unconstitutional. Charges against eight people, including two Michigan doctors, of genital mutilation of nine girls at a Detroit clinic were dismissed.

articles.description: With a growing number of states legalizing marijuana, lobbying efforts are also increasing in Washington, where spending has reached $2 million in 2018. Nushin Rashidian, co-founder and editor of Cannabis Wire, joins CBSN's "Red & Blue" with more.

articles.title: Thousands line up for first recreational pot sales in Massachusetts
articles.description: Recreational marijuana is now available for sale in Massachusetts. It's the seventh state to open retail marijuana shops, but the first to open east of the Mississippi. CBS News correspondent Tony Dokoupil reports.

articles.title: Man has cooked Thanksgiving dinner for strangers for past 33 years
articles.description: Scott Macaulay doesn't like eating alone, so 33 years ago he put an ad in the paper offering to cook Thanksgiving dinner for 12 people. He's been doing it ever since. "CBS Evening News" anchor Jeff Glor has his story.
